stimulusHtml: Which of the following accurately describes the overall change in the size of ships being built over the two centuries?

features.html:
SHIPS BUILT BY THE DUTCH EAST INDIA COMPANY IN THE SEVENTEENTH AND EIGHTEENTH CENTURIES

Size CategorySeventeenth CenturyEighteenth Century
Largest (over 1,000 tons) 53 219
Large (800 to 1,000 tons) 42 283
Small (500 to 800 tons) 199 175
Smallest (less than 500 tons) 412 78
Total706 755
Source: Adapted from J. R. Bruijn, F. S. Gaastra, Ivo Sch√∂ffer, Dutch-Asiatic Shipping in the 17th and 18th Centuries, Martinus Nijhoff Publishers, Alphen aan den Rijn, Netherlands, 1987, Volume I, p. 52.

choicesHtml: The Dutch East India Company produced the same proportion of ships in each category in both centuries.
The Dutch East India Company produced a higher proportion of ships in the larger two categories in the eighteenth century.
The Dutch East India Company produced a higher proportion of ships in the smaller two categories in the eighteenth century.
The Dutch East India Company produced a lower proportion of ships in the larger two categories in the eighteenth century.
